de.mcsocial.gui

Class MenuItem

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.mcsocial.gui.MenuItem
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AccountItem, ChunkItem, CityItem, HomeItem, JobItem, JobSelectItem, PlayerItem, WorldSpawn

    public abstract class MenuItem
extends Object
    MenuItem An item in a menu. Displays like an ItemStack in an inventory, and activates the onClick method when it is selected.
    Author:
    XHawk87

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MenuItem(String text)
      Create a new menu item with the given title text on mouse over Icon defaults to a piece of paper, and no number is displayed.
      MenuItem(String text, org.bukkit.material.MaterialData icon)
      Create a new menu item with the given title text on mouse over, and using the given MaterialData as its icon
      MenuItem(String text, org.bukkit.material.MaterialData icon, int number)
      Create a new menu item with the given title text on mouseover, using the given MaterialData as its icon, and displaying the given number

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods

      Adds an extra line to the description of the menu item to display on mouse over.

      Get the menu on which this item resides
      int getNumber()
      Get the number displayed on this item.

      Get the title text used as the mouse over text for this menu item
      abstract void onClick(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
      Called when a player clicks this menu item
      void setDescriptions(List<String> lines)
      Sets the detailed description of a menu item to display on mouse over.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MenuItem

        public MenuItem(String text)
        Create a new menu item with the given title text on mouse over Icon defaults to a piece of paper, and no number is displayed.
        Parameters:
        text - The title text to display on mouse over

      • MenuItem

        public MenuItem(String text,
                org.bukkit.material.MaterialData icon)
        Create a new menu item with the given title text on mouse over, and using the given MaterialData as its icon
        Parameters:
        text - The title text to display on mouse over
        icon - The material to use as its icon

      • MenuItem

        public MenuItem(String text,
                org.bukkit.material.MaterialData icon,
                int number)
        Create a new menu item with the given title text on mouseover, using the given MaterialData as its icon, and displaying the given number
        Parameters:
        text - The title text to display on mouse over
        icon - The material to use as its icon
        number - The number to display on the item (must be greater than 1)

    • Method Detail

      • getMenu

        public Menu getMenu()
        Get the menu on which this item resides
        Returns:
        The popup menu

      • getNumber

        public int getNumber()
        Get the number displayed on this item. 1 for no number displayed
        Returns:
        The number

      • getIcon

        public org.bukkit.material.MaterialData getIcon()
        Get the MaterialData used as the icon for this menu item
        Returns:
        The icon

      • getText

        public String getText()
        Get the title text used as the mouse over text for this menu item
        Returns:
        The title text

      • setDescriptions

        public void setDescriptions(List<String> lines)
        Sets the detailed description of a menu item to display on mouse over. Note that this does not automatically wrap text, so you must separate the strings into lines
        Parameters:
        lines - The lines of text to display as a description

      • addDescription

        public void addDescription(String line)
        Adds an extra line to the description of the menu item to display on mouse over. Note that this does not automatically wrap text, so you must separate the strings into multiple lines if they are too long.
        Parameters:
        line - The line to add to the display text description

      • onClick

        public abstract void onClick(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
        Called when a player clicks this menu item
        Parameters:
        player - The clicking player
